page.title: 07Farming, Swine/Coniston
page.content: The villages of Coniston and Swine in Holderness lie on the eastern edge of the Hull valley. Until comparatively recent times, large areas of the valley were frequently inundated at high tides. Over the centuries this resulted in thick peaty deposits on the alluvial valley floor ths creating rich and fertile agricultural land. The main crops are cereal (wheat and barley), beans and some root crops such as potatoes and turnips. The only sizeable dairy herd to be found is on the outskirts of Coniston. The landscape is low lying with the large open fields typical of the plain of Holderness. Most of the land in this area is crown property and the local farms are actually leased from the crown.
